required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Conducting a Telehealth Study Assessing the Removal of Filter Ventilation on Smoking Behavior and Biomarkers

lead_sponsor.agency: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

clinical_study.source: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

brief_summary.textblock: This open label, between-subject, randomized multi-center pilot study will assess the feasibility of conducting a study remotely with telehealth visits to assess the effect of cigarettes with minimal filter ventilation vs. moderate filter ventilation on smoking behavior and biomarkers of tobacco toxicant exposure. Subjective measures, alveolar carbon monoxide, blood pressure and cigarettes per a day will be collected remotely. Biological samples will be collected at home and mailed to the study clinic.

detailed_description.textblock: Smokers of cigarettes with about 16-30% ventilation in their conventional cigarettes who meet eligibility criteria will enter 3 weeks of monitoring of usual brand smoking. Subjects will then be randomly assigned for a period of 6 weeks to one of two conditions: 1) ventilated cigarettes; or 2) unventilated cigarettes. Subjects in each condition will be unblinded to simulate real world conditions. Subjects are provided with a debit card (ClinCard) that has been loaded with the appropriate amount of money to cover self-purchased usual brand cigarette in baseline and the assigned study cigarettes during intervention. Weekly telehealth visits will be conducted during baseline and the 6 weeks on study cigarettes to collect study measures, followed by a one month follow-up.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open label, between-subject, randomized multi-center pilot study

primary_outcome.description: Percent of drop-outs in baseline and post-randomization.
Degree of difficulty collecting data through telehealth visits, mailing in biosamples and self-purchase of cigarettes (descriptive statistics (e.g., percent or mean responses)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: effect size for each arm calculated as the baseline minus the 6 week value divided by the SD of this difference
secondary_outcome.description: The sum of nicotine and its metabolite concentrations used for evaluating nicotine exposure.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: effect size for each arm calculated as the baseline minus the 6 week value divided by the SD of this difference
secondary_outcome.description: One of the tobacco specific nitrosamines, one of the most important groups of carcinogens in tobacco products, which are formed from nicotine during the curing and processing of tobacco.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mean cigarettes per day (CPD)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: effect size for each arm calculated as the baseline minus the 6 week value divided by the SD of this difference
secondary_outcome.description: The change in mean cigarettes per day (CPD) based on 7 day ITR data before visit 00 and week 6 visit.

arm_group.description: Conventional cigarette with approximately 6-7% (non-menthol) and 5-6% filter ventilation (menthol).
Conventional cigarette with approximately 22-26% (non-menthol) and 35-38% filter ventilation (menthol).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 21 years of age or older
- Regular cigarette smoker
- Currently smoking an eligible brand
- Generally good health
- Access to smartphone or tablet and a device with a functioning camera for telehealth visits. Also must have internet access.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable health
- Uncontrolled high blood pressure
- Pregnant or breast-feeding

overall_official.affiliation: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

facility.name: The Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center
